neighbors.name: Lloyd S. Fultz Jr. & Dawn E. Fultz
neighbors.claims: Lloyd S. Fultz Jr. is a resident of Old Fields in Hardy County ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/2024/12/04/letter-to-the-editor-6/)). He has been publicly outspoken regarding local industrial agriculture impacts, specifically writing a letter to the editor arguing that Pilgrim’s Pride is a major local polluter and should be assessed fees to fund emergency services ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/2024/12/04/letter-to-the-editor-6/)). He also spoke at a July 2020 Hardy County Commission meeting regarding a poultry 'mega' house project, stating that approved projects 'take no consideration of the impacts on us' and expressing concern about workers and environmental degradation ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.s3.amazonaws.com/Moorefield+Examiner+7-1-20.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage regarding environmental safeguards and potential revenue benefits for emergency services, addressing his specific history of advocacy for corporate accountability and pollution control.

citations.claim: Resident of Old Fields; wrote LTE regarding Pilgrim's Pride fees and pollution
citations.title: Letter to the Editor: Pilgrim's Pride

citations.claim: Spoke at County Commission meeting opposing poultry project impacts
citations.title: Commission lays levy; hears from public on poultry project

neighbors.name: George Robert Shockey, Maude E. Shockey & Robert Shockey
neighbors.claims: George R. Shockey was born in Old Fields, WV in 1946 and lived there his entire life, passing away in November 2024 at age 78 ([Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/george-shockey)). He is survived by his wife, Maude “Sis” Shockey, and their son, Robert Shockey, who resides in Pennsylvania ([Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/george-shockey)). George was known for his passion for the outdoors, hunting, and fishing ([Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/george-shockey)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member reach out with respect for the Shockey family’s long local legacy and condolences regarding the recent passing of George.

citations.claim: George R. Shockey obituary details and survivors
citations.title: Obituary: George Robert Shockey

neighbors.name: Cary Joe Turner & Jennifer Turner
neighbors.claims: Jennifer Turner serves as Vice President at Grant County Bank and is a Board Member of the Hardy County Chamber of Commerce ([Hardy County Chamber](https://www.hardycountychamber.org/about)). Cary Joe Turner is a resident of Old Fields and son of the late Lysle Glenn Turner ([Giffin Funeral Home](https://www.giffinfuneralhome.com/obituaries/Lysle-G-Turner?obId=2491718)). Jennifer and Joe Turner attended a Hardy County Planning Commission meeting in September 2020 regarding a controversial poultry CAFO project, indicating engagement with local land-use issues ([Hardy County](http://www.hardycounty.com/files/documents/41406a02-4bb9-4f59-a61e-7fa82d700043.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach professionally acknowledging Jennifer's role in the local business community (Chamber/Bank); focus on economic benefits and orderly development.

citations.claim: Jennifer Turner is VP at Grant County Bank and Chamber Board Member
citations.title: Hardy County Chamber of Commerce: About Us

citations.claim: Cary Joe Turner family connection
citations.title: Obituary: Lysle Glenn Turner

citations.claim: Attended Planning Commission meeting regarding poultry CAFO
citations.title: Hardy County Planning Commission Minutes

neighbors.name: David Stephens & Shari Stephens
neighbors.claims: Shari Stephens is the Director of the Hardy County Family Support Center ([WV Bureau for Family Assistance](https://bfa.wv.gov/media/19456/download?inline)). She is a vocal advocate for social services in the region, frequently quoted in local media regarding the housing crisis, homelessness, and food insecurity in Hardy County ([Mountain State Spotlight](https://mountainstatespotlight.org/2025/04/01/affordable-housing-lawmakers-session/)). In interviews, she has highlighted the lack of affordable housing and shelters in the county ([Mountain State Spotlight](https://mountainstatespotlight.org/2024/10/16/voter-election-2024-potomac-highlands/)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Shari with a focus on community benefits, specifically how the project might support the local tax base or social services, given her professional focus on housing and family support.

citations.claim: Shari Stephens is Director of Hardy County Family Support Center
citations.title: 2025-2026 Family Support Center Directory

citations.claim: Quoted regarding housing crisis and homelessness
citations.title: As lawmakers debate affordable housing, West Virginians struggle to find homes

citations.claim: Discussed homelessness and lack of shelters
citations.title: Voters in the Potomac Highlands want better jobs and housing

neighbors.name: Leslie Wade Armentrout & Shelly Dawn Martin
neighbors.claims: Leslie Wade Armentrout is employed as an Assistant Football Coach at Moorefield High School, a position effective from the 2023-2024 school year ([Hardy County Schools](https://core-docs.s3.amazonaws.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/1883/HCS/2897957/Bd.Agenda__3.20.23.pdf)). Neither Armentrout nor Shelly Dawn Martin appear in available public records regarding local development debates or civic leadership roles.
neighbors.influence_justification: Public school employee; no political role

approach_recommendations.engage: Acknowledge his role in the local school community to build rapport; provide transparent project details focusing on minimal disruption to daily life.

citations.claim: Leslie Wade Armentrout is employed as an Assistant Football Coach at Moorefield High School
citations.title: Hardy County Board of Education Meeting Agenda March 20, 2023

neighbors.name: Steven C. Pendleton
neighbors.claims: Steven C. Pendleton is a contributor to the Moorefield Examiner and a representative of the 'Concerned Citizens of Old Fields' ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.s3.amazonaws.com/Moorefield+Examiner+11-18-20.pdf)). He has actively opposed large-scale agricultural development, specifically a poultry complex in Old Fields, citing concerns about property values, health, and water quality ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.s3.amazonaws.com/Moorefield+Examiner+8-26-20.pdf)). Pendleton has challenged the Hardy County Planning Commission regarding transparency and adherence to Open Meeting Laws ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.s3.amazonaws.com/Moorefield+Examiner+4_14_21.pdf)). He has publicly stated, 'If my property value drops, who wants to buy it? That's a very personal concern to me' ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.s3.amazonaws.com/Moorefield+Examiner+8-26-20.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Leader of citizens group; media contributor

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage early with high transparency; anticipate scrutiny regarding zoning compliance and property value impacts. Demonstrate strict adherence to open meeting regulations.

citations.claim: Representative of the 'Concerned Citizens of Old Fields'
citations.title: Moorefield Examiner - Planning Commission to Form Committee

citations.claim: Opposed large-scale agricultural development citing property values and health
citations.title: Moorefield Examiner - Residents Voice Concerns

citations.claim: Challenged Planning Commission on Open Meeting Laws
citations.title: Moorefield Examiner - Planning Commission Meetings Cancelled

neighbors.name: Eric A. Tasker
neighbors.claims: Eric A. Tasker is a Hardy County resident who attended the June 23, 2020, Hardy County Planning Commission meeting regarding the controversial Old Fields poultry complex ([Hardy County](http://hardycounty.com/files/documents/755f9260-7b5a-4bbd-8198-54e2ddbd070a.pdf)). He has been listed in local legal notices regarding estate administration ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.s3.amazonaws.com/ME_8_14_19.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Attends planning meetings; no leadership role

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach one-on-one; he monitors local planning activities but does not appear to speak publicly. Address potential concerns about zoning changes.

He does not appear in other available public records for community leadership or activism.

neighbors.name: Ernest E. Wolfe & Deborah A. Wolfe
neighbors.claims: Ernest E. Wolfe and Deborah A. Wolfe are listed as owners of a parcel in Hardy County, WV. Public records indicate an Ernest E. Wolfe with a death date in 1999 ([rootsweb.com](https://sites.rootsweb.com/~armpgs/morning_star_cemetery.htm)), suggesting the property may be held in a life estate or estate trust, though specific details of the current arrangement could not be independently verified. No public records of either Ernest or Deborah holding local office or speaking in recent county meetings regarding the Old Fields Solar project or other developments could be found ([moorefieldexaminer.com](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/2025/10/21/open-house-shares-details-of-solar-farm-plan-in-old-fields/)). They have not been identified in news reports or public debates related to energy projects in the area.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach respectfully through personal outreach, emphasizing how any plans can align with preserving their family land use and quiet rural lifestyle.

citations.claim: Public records indicate an Ernest E. Wolfe with a death date in 1999
citations.title: Morning Star Cemetery Transcriptions

citations.claim: No public records of either Ernest or Deborah holding local office or speaking in recent county meetings regarding the Old Fields Solar project
citations.title: Open House Shares Details of Solar Farm Plan in Old Fields

neighbors.name: Kevin M. Helmick II
neighbors.claims: Kevin M. Helmick II has served as a police officer in Moorefield and was highlighted for his role as a K9 handler and drug recognition expert with the Moorefield Police Department ([wv.ng.mil](https://www.wv.ng.mil/News/Article/2408406/helmick-named-wvng-soldier-spotlight-for-november-2020/)). He is also a member of the West Virginia National Guard, having deployed to Afghanistan ([wv.ng.mil](https://www.wv.ng.mil/News/Article/2408406/helmick-named-wvng-soldier-spotlight-for-november-2020/)). Aside from law enforcement-related news, there is no public record of Helmick taking a stance on development or participating in land use debates in Hardy County.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a community safety perspective. Given his law enforcement background, emphasize open communication and how project plans address local safety and traffic concerns.

citations.claim: Kevin M. Helmick II has served as a police officer in Moorefield and was highlighted for his role as a K9 handler
citations.title: Helmick Named WVNG Soldier Spotlight for November 2020

neighbors.name: Wayne A. Hudson & Sharon M. Hudson
neighbors.claims: Wayne A. Hudson and his spouse Sharon M. Hudson own property in Hardy County but maintain a low public profile. No evidence was found of either holding any public office or speaking out at county meetings or hearings ([moorefieldexaminer.com](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/2025/10/21/open-house-shares-details-of-solar-farm-plan-in-old-fields/)). They have not been mentioned in local news regarding development, indicating no visible involvement in community disputes or advocacy on such issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in a neighborly manner through personal contact. Emphasize listening to any concerns they have about property or infrastructure to build trust, since they are not publicly outspoken.

citations.claim: No evidence was found of either holding any public office or speaking out at county meetings or hearings
citations.title: Open House Shares Details of Solar Farm Plan in Old Fields

neighbors.name: Raymond Lee Orndorff III (Trustee for Alexis Rae Orndorff)
neighbors.claims: This parcel is held in a trust arrangement: Raymond Lee Orndorff III is listed as trustee on behalf of Alexis Rae Orndorff. Alexis Rae (“Lexi”) Orndorff is a younger family member from the area who has pursued nursing at WVU Potomac State College after overcoming a health challenge ([medicine.wvu.edu](https://medicine.wvu.edu/News/Story?headline=first-hand-experience-with-cancer-inspires-keyser-campus-nursing-student-to-help-others)). Neither the trustee nor the beneficiary have any documented involvement in local political or planning matters, and no public comments on development have been found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via personal connection through family networks. Emphasize how any development proposal can respect their family’s long-term legacy and future plans for the land.

citations.claim: Alexis Rae (“Lexi”) Orndorff is a younger family member from the area who has pursued nursing at WVU Potomac State College after overcoming a health challenge
citations.title: First-hand experience with cancer inspires Keyser Campus nursing student to help others

neighbors.name: Amber N. King, David A. King & Rosemary E. King
neighbors.claims: Amber N. King, David A. King, and Rosemary E. King jointly own their Hardy County parcel. An Amber N. King has been identified as a student at Glenville State College in West Virginia ([glenville.edu](https://www.glenville.edu/news/students-named-spring-2017-honor-lists-gsc)). There are no public news articles or meeting records that mention the King family with regard to development or civic issues in the county. They have not publicly advocated for or against land development, and none of the Kings appear in local leadership roles or community boards as per available records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a family-oriented approach. Reaching out via a community gathering or introduction by a mutual acquaintance may help, focusing on listening to any family concerns or needs.

citations.claim: An Amber N. King has been identified as a student at Glenville State College in West Virginia
citations.title: Students Named to Spring 2017 Honor Lists at GSC

neighbors.name: Evans Ruth E
neighbors.claims: Ruth E. Evans (Ruth Evans Hardy) was a lifelong resident of Hardy County and an active member of the Oak Dale Christian Church and Rig Civic Center [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/ruth-hardy). She passed away in November 2009 at age 79, and was survived by her husband (who passed in 2018) and a son residing in Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/ruth-hardy).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate through her surviving son or estate administrator. Outreach should acknowledge the family’s long local roots in Rig and their history with the local church and civic center.

citations.claim: Ruth E. Evans (Ruth Evans Hardy) was a lifelong resident of Hardy County and an active member of the Oak Dale Christian Church and Rig Civic Center
citations.title: Obituary for Ruth Evans Hardy

citations.claim: She passed away in November 2009 at age 79, and was survived by her husband (who passed in 2018) and a son residing in Hardy County
citations.title: Obituary for Ruth Evans Hardy

neighbors.name: Fittipaldi Joseph E & Carol A Geraci
neighbors.claims: Joseph E. Fittipaldi resides in the Old Fields area of Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/audrey-fittipaldi). His late mother, Audrey Fittipaldi, was born in Hardy County but spent much of her life in New York City before returning to Moorefield in later years [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/audrey-fittipaldi).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local resident; no public office found

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Joseph Fittipaldi with a focus on preserving the quiet, rural character of Old Fields, acknowledging his family's return to the area from an urban environment.

citations.claim: Joseph E. Fittipaldi resides in the Old Fields area of Hardy County
citations.title: Obituary for Audrey Jane Fittipaldi

neighbors.name: Wolfe Ernest E & Deborah A Life & Lawrence E Wolfe
neighbors.claims: Ernest E. Wolfe and his wife Deborah A. Wolfe reside in the Old Fields area of Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). They are part of a multi-generational local family; Ernest’s mother, Rama Wolfe (1932–2019), lived her entire life in Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). Ernest's aunt, Velda V. Wolfe, also resides in Old Fields, indicating a strong family presence in the immediate vicinity [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe).
neighbors.influence_justification: Established local family with extended ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact through a respected local neighbor. Emphasize the project's alignment with preserving family land legacies, as the Wolfe family has deep multi-generational roots in Old Fields.

Wolfe is an elderly landowner residing in Old Fields and is the sister of the late Rama Wolfe [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). She has family ties to Ernest E. Wolfe, who resides nearby in Old Fields [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with care through family channels, specifically her nephew Ernest Wolfe. Communications should focus on respect for the family's long tenure on the land.

neighbors.name: Bosley Jack W & Susan J
neighbors.claims: Jack W. Bosley is a Reverend who has served in the local religious community, evidenced by his pastoral title in local condolences [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). The Bosley family has a multi-generational presence in Hardy County, with records dating back to the 19th century [1940 U.S. Census (Hardy County)](https://ldsgenealogy.com/WV/1940-Census-Moorefield-WV.htm).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Rev. Bosley with high respect for his community role. A face-to-face introduction that emphasizes community values and preservation of the rural landscape is recommended.

overview_summary: Of the 19 neighbors profiled, 18 are residents and one is an organization, with 16 stances currently unknown, two in opposition, and one in support. The group includes one high-influence individual and seven medium-influence neighbors, including the Wolfe and Sites families who hold influence through long-standing landownership and generational ties. Identified opposition is focused on industrial impacts, while notable entities include South Branch Enterprises Inc and residents with public profiles in local media and law enforcement.
